list.name: Changes
list.comment: successfully added a "add_note" bot command - had trouble with syncing the new bot command to the bot and resolved it by reinviting the bot to the server. not sure if this is a 100% solution tho

task.summary: initial commit - just added basic code file and README file
re-wrote the code for basic bot (found in YouTube tutorial)
re-wrote the code for basic bot (found in YouTube tutorial)
fixed push conflicts - hopefully it works this time
made a .gitignore file (i thought it was already made & pushed but apparently it's in a folder that makes it "unversioned")
just committed a file in .idea that didn't get included in the last push
downloaded and imported google sheets API (will need to figure out how it works & how to download pytnon3.10.7 in Oracle Cloud VM)

enabled Google Sheets API according to google's Quickstart page, downloaded the Google Cloud Client ID json supposedly used to identify any app I create through google's OAuth servers, and updated .gitignore
updated a testing spreadsheet's ID, and access/edit cell ranges of choice
added a google sheets API testing function (found from a tutorial bot)

updated .gitignore, and trying to fix the bot commands - right now the client events take over without rather than letting the bot commands function run so all i get is from the bot is "i don't understand"

turns out i can only use either "client" instance or "bot" instance, not both since it may cause whatever conflicts. Removed "client" instance. Bot is now running properly but the "/test" command still isn't

turns out the error comes from the google sheets API, and the error is simply because I added the wrong sheet name in the google sheet (it's supposed to be "Worksheet1", not "sheet1"). Now there's an "InteractionResponded" error but I'm guessing that doesn't affect much

fixed the test function - turns out an interaction instance can only respond to a command ONCE. I have multiple values in my read range, which makes the bot respond multiple times, which causes an error. Solution is to append all values into an array then use join() function, or append all values into a string
successfully added a "add_note" bot command - had trouble with syncing the new bot command to the bot and resolved it by reinviting the bot to the server. not sure if this is a 100% solution tho
